griffon.core.event

Interface EventPublisher

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventRouter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEventPublisher, AbstractEventRouter, DefaultEventPublisher, DefaultEventRouter

    public interface EventPublisher
    Base contract for classes that can publish events using their own event bus.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Andres Almiray

    • Method Detail

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(@Nonnull
                    Object listener)
        Adds an event listener.

        Accepted types are: Script, Map and Object.

        Parameters:
        listener - an event listener

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(@Nonnull
                    String eventName,
                    @Nonnull
                    CallableWithArgs<?> listener)
        Adds a callable as an event listener.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event
        listener - an event listener

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(@Nonnull
                    Map<String,CallableWithArgs<?>> listener)
        Adds a Map containing event listeners.

        An event listener may be a

        • a CallableWithArgs

        Maps require handlers to be named as eventName only.

        Some examples of eventHandler names are: StartupStart, MyCoolEvent. Event names must follow the camelCase naming convention.

        Parameters:
        listener - an event listener of type Map

      • addEventListener

        <E extends Event> void addEventListener(@Nonnull
                                      Class<E> eventClass,
                                      @Nonnull
                                      CallableWithArgs<?> listener)
        Adds a callable as an event listener.

        Parameters:
        eventClass - the type of the event
        listener - an event listener

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(@Nonnull
                       Object listener)
        Removes an event listener.

        Accepted types are: Script, Map and Object.

        Parameters:
        listener - an event listener

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(@Nonnull
                       String eventName,
                       @Nonnull
                       CallableWithArgs<?> listener)
        Removes a callable as an event listener.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event
        listener - an event listener

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(@Nonnull
                       Map<String,CallableWithArgs<?>> listener)
        Removes a Map containing event listeners.

        An event listener may be a

        • a CallableWithArgs

        Maps require handlers to be named as eventName only.

        Some examples of eventHandler names are: StartupStart, MyCoolEvent. Event names must follow the camelCase naming convention.

        Parameters:
        listener - an event listener of type Map

      • removeEventListener

        <E extends Event> void removeEventListener(@Nonnull
                                         Class<E> eventClass,
                                         @Nonnull
                                         CallableWithArgs<?> listener)
        Removes a callable as an event listener.

        Parameters:
        eventClass - the type of the event
        listener - an event listener

      • publishEvent

        void publishEvent(@Nonnull
                String eventName)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified in the same thread as the publisher.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event

      • publishEvent

        void publishEvent(@Nonnull
                String eventName,
                @Nullable
                List<?> args)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified in the same thread as the publisher.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event
        args - event arguments sent to listeners

      • publishEvent

        void publishEvent(@Nonnull
                Event event)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified in the same thread as the publisher.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to be published

      • publishEventOutsideUI

        void publishEventOutsideUI(@Nonnull
                         String eventName)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified outside of the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event

      • publishEventOutsideUI

        void publishEventOutsideUI(@Nonnull
                         String eventName,
                         @Nullable
                         List<?> args)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified outside of the UI thread.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event
        args - event arguments sent to listeners

      • publishEventAsync

        void publishEventAsync(@Nonnull
                     String eventName)
        Publishes an event.

        Listeners will be notified in a different thread.

        Parameters:
        eventName - the name of the event

      • isEventPublishingEnabled

        boolean isEventPublishingEnabled()
        Returns whether events will be published by the event bus or not.
        Returns:
        true if event publishing is enabled; false otherwise.

      • setEventPublishingEnabled

        void setEventPublishingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled state for event publishing.

        Events will be automatically discarded when the enabled state is set to false.
        Parameters:
        enabled - the value fot the enabled state.
